suncertify.db
Class RecordMetaData

java.lang.Object
  suncertify.db.RecordMetaData

public final class RecordMetaData
extends java.lang.Object

Enables to collect and verify and provides the record meta data (also referred to as schema description) for a database record, as specified in the header section of the database file.

Although the written specification is quite explicit about field names, lengths, and descriptive field names, it still leaves the order of the fields in a database record unspecified. A RecordMetaData object is filled when reading the database file header while initializing the DBFileAccess Singleton instance.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Lars Kuettner

clear

public void clear()
Clears the Singleton instance to reuse it in a subsequent program run. Especially useful in a testing environment.

addField

public void addField(java.lang.String fieldName,
                     int fieldLength)
Adds the record field metadata fieldName and fieldLength as read from the database file header, and updates the record length on the way.

Parameters:
fieldName - a string representing the name of the field
fieldLength - the field length in bytes

getRecordLength

public int getRecordLength()
Returns the record length which is updated when adding the fields.

Returns:
the length of the record in bytes

public int getFieldNameIndex(java.lang.String fieldName)
Returns an index given a field name.

Returns:

getFieldLength

public int getFieldLength(int fieldIndex)
Returns the maximum length of a record field given its index.

Parameters:
fieldIndex - the index of the record field
Returns:

recordToContractor

public static Contractor recordToContractor(java.lang.String[] record)
Converts a string array-based database record to a property-based Contractor object.

Parameters:
record - the string array representing the database record
Returns:
the corresponding Contractor object
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the RecordMetaData instance has not been fully initialized or if the length of the record does not correspond to the expected number of fields of a database record

contractorToRecord

public static java.lang.String[] contractorToRecord(Contractor contractor)
Converts a Contractor object to a string array-based record. The order in which the individual properties are organized in the string array is determined by the schema of the database file.

Parameters:
contractor - the Contractor object
Returns:
the string array representing the corresponding database record
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the RecordMetaData instance has not been fully initialized
